questions.neutral: Did you walk the long way?

hobby.message: Found any new political literature lately?
Any new mods on your FPV quad?
Urban exploration or just avoiding work?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Yeah, took the roundabout way tonight. Needed the walk.
Spent some time with my hobby — urban exploration.
Hard to do these days with everything being watched.
Recent changes made it even trickier, that's all.
Yeah, long way in. Easier to stay out of the crowds.
I do a bit of urban exploration on the side.
Last week, locals blocked off the usual tunnel entrances.
Not many safe spots left for it.
People are getting more territorial with these assemblies.
Took the scenic route, if you can call it that now.
I like poking around the old tunnels, urban exploration sort of thing.
Used to be quiet spots under the city for it.
Since the committees took over, some access points get sealed or monitored.
Had to dodge a neighborhood patrol just last weekend.
Still, nothing like seeing how the city's guts really work.
Took the long way in, avoiding some new checkpoints.
Honestly, urban exploration is my hobby — utility tunnels, old server rooms.
It’s gotten weird since these neighborhood assemblies started rerouting things.
Last Friday, I lost access to my favorite entrance.
Ran into a couple of others down there, same problem.
Funny how our secret spots aren’t so secret now.
Sometimes I wonder if there’s anywhere left you can just disappear in peace.
Definitely the long way. Needed time to clear my head.
My hobby’s urban exploration — real deep dives into the city’s old utility grids.
I started back before the BCI was even a thing — fewer cameras then.
Nowadays, committees are sealing off tunnels, reclaiming spaces for resource votes.
Last week I got locked out of two sites by a local patrol. Nearly froze.
Met someone hauling parts — turns out they're all avoiding street-level allocation too.
Funny, the city’s supposed to be automated, but it feels more closed off now.
Feels like the only places left to explore are the ones everyone’s forgotten, or fighting over.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still at it. Keeps me occupied.
Not as easy getting into places lately.
Lots of areas shut off by the locals now.
Assemblies have eyes everywhere these days.
Still, the tunnels haven’t gone anywhere.
Yeah, still poking around when I can.
Some old access points got locked after all that assembly mess.
People watch outsiders like hawks now.
Last week, almost got stuck in a dead zone.
Harder to relax down there these days.
City feels more suspicious everywhere, not just topside.
Urban exploration is still good for my nerves.
Been running into blocked passages since the assemblies took over.
Funny how the tunnels used to be anonymous, now they’re crowded.
Met a few folks hiding server parts from committee checks.
With the BCI chaos, nobody patrols much, but you’re never alone.
It’s not as peaceful, but it’s interesting.
I keep my routes flexible. Never know what’s changed each week.
Still walking the tunnels. Feels strange, honestly.
Assemblies running things upstairs shook the usual routines.
Saw more repair folks and night wanderers hiding from committee rules.
Last week, Mila and I stumbled on a half-powered transformer room.
The city used to ignore tunnel rats. Now we’re all ghosts together.
Heard someone using old badge codes just to charge their comm.
Makes me nostalgic for the days when power routines meant something.
We trade stories. Feels like we’re mapping forgotten arteries.
Urban exploring’s my therapy. Keeps me sane while the city loses the plot.
I watched the old Filyarsk tunnels empty out since Halden died.
After assemblies took over, folks got pushed out of everywhere above ground.
Last Friday, I shared vodka in the dark with other outcasts.
Nobody patrols. City doesn’t care. It’s a free zone — or a no man’s land.
Saw a kid stripping out servers, hiding from both committees and the old BCI logs.
I used to map power redundancies for fun. Now, half my notes are just rumors.
Sometimes we light up a whole corridor just to feel the hum.
Strange how being forgotten by both sides is freeing... and a little lonely.
